elements.title: Serviola (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2019, the Spanish patrol boat Serviola (pictured) thwarted two attempts at piracy in as many months?

elements.title: Mahurangi Harbour (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after being extensively hunted in the 19th century, southern right whales can again sometimes be seen in Mahurangi Harbour?

elements.title: Richard W. Conway (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Richard W. Conway earned a varsity letter, a Ph.D., and an endowed chair, all from the same university?

elements.title: superstitions in Britain (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to two surveys, knocking on wood and 'crossing fingers for good luck' are the most popular superstitions in Britain?

elements.title: Ella van Poucke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ella van Poucke, a cellist who studied at the Kronberg Academy, returned there as a soloist, playing Haydn's Cello Concerto No. 1 in the new Casals Forum?

elements.title: sold notebook computers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nippon Steel, one of Japan's largest steelmakers, sold notebook computers in the U.S. in the early 1990s?

elements.title: Lanfranco Cirillo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lanfranco Cirillo is the architect of Putin's Palace, a palace complex on the Black Sea coast allegedly built for Vladimir Putin which is estimated to have cost over one billion US dollars?

elements.title: Patterson's Spade Mill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that couples can marry 'over the anvil' at Patterson's Spade Mill?
